title: Drawing, "The Elevation of a Console Table", 1800–75
medium: Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and ink on light bluish paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower left: Cooper Union [Lugt 457c]
provenance: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt
creditline: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt
description: Curved legs with women’s heads on top. Griffins flank a lyre on the ledge connecting the legs. Their tails end with rinceaux which rise along the legs. The frieze of the table top shows a frieze of palmettes and griffins.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Elevation of a Console Table", 1800–75.
1800–75. Graphite, pen and black ink, brush and ink on light bluish paper. Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt. 1931-64-82.
